programme.title: Wildest Africa: Congo: the Untamed Heart
programme.desc: Known for centuries as Africa's Dark Heart, the Congo is a multi-layered, three-dimensional world, seething with innumerable species. By peeling back the layers, we discover how this vast rainforest works, and expose the hidden lives of its inhabitants.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Mount Kenya: African Heart of Ice
programme.desc: Mount Kenya soars over 5km into the air. It is the second highest mountain in Africa. At its summit, temperatures fluctuate from over 30 degrees celsius to below freezing.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Namibia: Sands of Time
programme.desc: Namibia is an arid, rough land. However, it has been inhabited for thousands of years, by people as well as animals, and shows no sign of losing popularity with either.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Zambezi: Wild Water
programme.desc: The Zambezi is one of Africa's most influential rivers. It supports some of the continent's most spectacular wildlife. However, the Zambezi's long and winding journey destroys, as well as creates.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Lake Turkana: Land of the Crocodile
programme.desc: The largest of Africa's Rift valley lakes, Lake Turkana is at the heart of one of the harshest landscapes on the planet. Despite its hostile environment, man and beast have both worked out a way to survive.

programme.title: My All American
programme.desc: Freddie Steinmark, an underdog on the gridiron, faces the toughest challenge of his life after leading his team to a championship season.

programme.title: Bottle Shock
programme.desc: The story of the early days of California wine making featuring the now infamous, blind Paris wine tasting of 1976 that has come to be known as "Judgment of Paris". Feat: Chris Pine, Alan Rickman & Bill Pullman.

programme.title: The Heist
programme.desc: A comedy centered on three museum security guards who devise a plan to steal back the artworks to which they have become attached after they are transferred to another museum. Starring: Morgan Freeman, Christopher Walken, Joseph McKenna, Wynn Everett

programme.title: Jungle Goddess
programme.desc: Jungle Goddess: An heiress stranded in Africa is made queen of the jungle in the feature film and Bela Lugosi stars in the short The Phantom Creeps.

programme.title: Hamlet

programme.title: Swamp Diamonds

programme.title: Deadly Women

programme.title: Deadly Women

programme.title: Deadly Women: Obsession
programme.desc: Deciphering what causes minds to corkscrew out of control is the complex work of the criminal profiler. Obsessions can take many forms: beauty, devotion, ego and power.

programme.title: Deadly Women

programme.title: The FBI Files: Small Town Terror

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A daring kidnapping and a bizarre ransom note baffled Mississippi authorities. The victim was the wife of a wealthy businessman. A list of 12 names and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Despite what you see in the movies, most bank robbers come in quietly, pass a note, and slip away. They want cash, not bloodshed. But in Richmond, Virginia, a pair of gunmen entered a bank with their guns blazing.

programme.desc: The Chase" focuses on Africa’s predators and how they hunt -- from cheetahs running down gazelles to lions taking on the mighty buffalo. Even the best hunters can be outrun and outwitted.

programme.title: Beautiful Serengeti: Migration
programme.desc: Great herds take center stage as what’s at stake is revealed for those with no home but the ground they find themselves standing on. The herds run the gamut of predators, as well as pressures unique to this nomadic way of life.

programme.title: Beautiful Serengeti: The Hunt
programme.desc: The Hunt" focuses on hunters and hunting, and the brutal ending of a life -- an act which sustains another’s. The hunt is by far the most dramatic event taking place on the plains of the Serengeti.

programme.title: Beautiful Serengeti: Protection
programme.desc: Animals use all sorts of strategies to protect their families and food from marauders.

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges: The Humber Bridge

programme.title: Britain's Lost Battlefields With Rob Bell: The Battle of Hastings

programme.title: The New Detectives: Scattered Clues

programme.title: The New Detectives: Military Justice
programme.desc: The Naval Criminal Investigative Service uses forensic science to solve three perplexing murders and fulfill their motto: To the living we owe respect; to the dead, we owe the truth.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Patterns Of Guilt
programme.desc: The tread of a tire, a single shoe print and even the shape of a bruise help investigators track down killers, based solely on their patterns of guilt.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Blind Trust
programme.desc: A woman's body is found and investigators have little time and few clues to lead them to a killer who could strike again. Perpetrators try to conceal their crimes, yet savvy investigators can take the most obscure data and recreate a murder.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Remnant of Blame
programme.desc: The solution to the most heinous crimes often hinge on the smallest of clues. Investigators must have their eyes trained to find the full story of a murder written in a single scrap of evidence.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tent City
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bounty Baby
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joining the hunt. Can Dog keep his daughter safe and catch his man?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bustin' with Justin
programme.desc: Dog and the team must deal with misleading informants, belligerent boaters, and angry drunks when they go after Kimberly, a traffic offender with over 20 violations. And if that isn't enough, Dog has another problem - Duane Lee is sick.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Rocky Mountain Roundup
programme.desc: Dog decides to help two of his bondsmen buddies, Dave "Red" Widhelm and "Downtown" Bobby Brown. First up is Red, who has a client, named Alvin, whose bond is $20,000. Then the team goes after Craig, a client of Bobby's whose bond is almost $70,000.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: This One's For You
programme.desc: Dog leads the team on another adrenaline-filled chase in Denver. The fugitive, Robert, has a habit of address-hopping that makes him a difficult target, but Dog refuses to give up and finally tracks Robert down in his latest hideaway.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mama's Boys
programme.desc: Dog visits his mother's grave for inspiration before heading out to find Frankie, a violent fugitive hiding in the jungle. The spirit of Ma Chapman seems to help when Dog finds an unusual ally; Frankie's mother.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bait and Switch
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting. When the fugitive's girlfriend offers to help Dog trap this dangerous felon, Dog knows that someone is being deceived. The only question is, whom?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surprise! Surprise!
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mid-Course Correction
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jase and the Argonauts
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working. But when Jase thinks this is unfair, he takes matters into his own hands and finds a better object to use as motivation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fowl Playhouse
programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep themselves. But the playhouse ends up looking more like a military-style duck blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Big LeCOWski
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works. But when Willie questions Jase's ingenuity in creating new products they get into a debate.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Governor's Travels
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack and Gown
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation. Willie and Si join in, and Jase tries to keep them from imparting their "college advice" on Reed.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hands on a Woodchipper
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize: a woodchipper.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack Draft
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day. Meanwhile, Phil and Si accompany Miss Kay on a trip to visit a family grave.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Brand of Brothers
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image, so he and the guys create their own new logo and business cards. Meanwhile, Willie and Phil help Bella with her science project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: De-Bug Life
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home. Meanwhile, while the kids are running the church car wash, Si and Willie disagree on the best way to draw in customers.

programme.title: Jail: Pot For Poker
programme.desc: A drug peddler claims he's selling to support his addiction to poker.

programme.title: Jail: Landlord Attack
programme.desc: A woman fakes being sick to get out of jail.

programme.title: Jail: Wigging Out
programme.desc: A couple is taken into custody for lewd and indecent exposure.

programme.title: Jail: Exercise With Caution
programme.desc: An uncooperative inmate complicates things.

programme.title: Ice Pilots: Ice Storm
programme.desc: Buffalo's Electra aircraft is hammered by rough winds up the Mackenzie Valley. In Hay River, a rookie crew faces the worst ice storm in years and one rampie has a tough go trying to fit in at Buffalo.

programme.title: Ice Pilots: Old Dogs
programme.desc: Engine trouble plagues Buffalo's newest Electra, ZFE, and a standoff between Joe and Transport Canada threatens to close the airline. At the same time, Joe faces a tough decision about his old dog Sophie.

programme.title: Ice Pilots: Checkflight
programme.desc: Joe leaves to undergo medical tests at the Mayo Clinic in Phoenix, Arizona. Jeff and Sam stress over their DC-3 checkflights and Joe celebrates turning 70-his way.

programme.desc: Emily is 29 and a virgin. The pressure from her boyfriend Romeo to have sex is overwhelming. Their 20 year age difference may be part of the problem because she chats it up more with strangers than him. Can Judge Toler help them find common ground?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Sixth Sense
programme.desc: Takashia says Brendon doesn’t approve of her friends, doesn’t trust her and is controlling. Brendon says he can’t trust Takashia because she is a nonstop attention seeker and never passes up an opportunity to flirt with men.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Lonely Nights
programme.desc: Christina says Ramon is a cheater, runs from his financial responsibilities and their sex life is in the gutter. He’s tired of her enabling his family to the point, he takes refuge in hotel rooms to get a break from her.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Thin Line Between Love and Hate
programme.desc: When the going got tough, Dermartess left his children and Rofiesha. Dermartess says Rofiesha forced him to leave 7 years ago. He still loves her and wants to see his children but believes she was too toxic. Can Judge Lynn Toler save this couple?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Irreplaceable
programme.desc: Quanasia can no longer deal with Chandler's lying just so he can have his affairs. Chandler says she lost her drive after having his kids. Can Judge Toler wake her up from Chandler's hypnotizing charm or is this couple a lost cause?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Hot Tamale
programme.desc: Madeline says Edward is more of a detective than a husband. Edward says anytime Madeline is upset, she takes it out by destroying property in the house. She has destroyed an entire apartment and he can’t take it anymore.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Computer Love
programme.desc: As soon as this couple got engaged their romance hit the rocks. Brandi says that Brittanie can’t tell the truth if her life depended on it. Brittanie says Brandi’s insecurities and lack of trust has had a severe effect on their relationship.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Not Man Enough
programme.desc: No matter how hard Demont tries, he's always looking up at the bar Reasha keeps raising. Demont got a promotion and relocated for work, which raised her suspicions of him cheating. Can this couple ignite the spark or is this relationship totaled?

programme.title: Divorce Court: In My Feelings
programme.desc: Raymond, also known as @IamRollingRay, is an Instagram sensation who says his high school sweetheart is jealous of his social media fan base. Christian thinks Ray shows more attention to his fanbase, accusing him of cheating with his followers.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Old Town Road
programme.desc: Jennifer says Josh's lies have left her and their family homeless. He has made many hurtful decisions like selling her car and dumping her dog while she was giving birth to their son. Can he pave the way for a future?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Done Done
programme.desc: Nichele says Stewart would pay the neighbors to spy on her. She says he was never supportive when it came to parenting. Stewart says Nichele has always denied cheating on him but he believes in his heart she did.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Johnny on the Spot
programme.desc: Cornisha says Jawaun leaves for weeks at a time and returns broke and jobless. He says Cornisha is too bossy and picks fights causing him to blow up and take days away to cool down. Will they find a cooling point before their relationship melts down?

programme.title: Moesha: Break It Down

programme.title: Moesha: Rhythm Dues

programme.title: Moesha: The Double Date

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: South Hertfordshire

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Surrey

programme.title: Location, Location, Location: Midlothian

programme.title: Dynasty: Blake's Blindness

programme.title: Dynasty: The Hearing

programme.title: Dynasty: The Iago Syndrome

programme.title: Dynasty: The Party

programme.title: Dynasty: The Baby
programme.desc: Fallon gives birth to a son; Alexis offers Sammy Jo $25,000 to leave Denver; Jeff and Claudia make love; Krystle accuses Alexis of killing her baby; Alexis learns Krystle and Blake are not legally married.

programme.title: Dynasty: Mother and Son
programme.desc: Upon learning he is not her true father, Fallon refuses to see Blake; Jeff falls in love with Claudia, who is caught stealing from Denver-Carrington; Fallon's baby undergoes emergency surgery; Claudia's husband and daughter are believed dead.

programme.desc: Woman locks daughter out, sues for unpaid rent; daughter countersues for damages citing illegal eviction. Man denies owing ex-girlfriend for uninsured motorcycle he totaled, despite $17,000 pay-off amount left on co-signed vehicle.

programme.desc: The emotional burial of a pet Chihuahua leads to a violent, bloody assault between family members/A woman sues her ex-fiancé for a loan to buy a home. He claims she wrecked his truck while driving drunk, so he’s not paying.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.112

programme.title: World's Greatest: Nearshore Islands
programme.desc: Some of the world’s greatest islands are so close that they blend in with the mainland. But regardless of their size and origins, they are often the islands we are drawn to the most, each forging their own unique identity.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: Extreme Animals features environments hostile to humans, but havens to many animals. Witness gorgeous glow-worms, high flying condors, parched thorny devils, emperor penguins, and polar bears in this journey through life on the edge.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Grassland Animals
programme.desc: Grasslands are the great stages of the natural world where large animals play out spectacular lives in clear view of people, including lions, leopards, elephants, rhinoceros, cheetahs, impalas, kangaroos, wallaby, potoroo, bison, and wolves.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Deserts
programme.desc: For all their reputation as inhospitable places, deserts are full of incredible plants and animals that have adapted to the climate. They are bursting with geological wonders that inspire and are home to some of the most life in the world.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanoes
programme.desc: There are few sights on earth as compelling as a volcanic eruption. Volcanoes have the potential to cause death and widespread destruction in a heartbeat, but they also give rise to new life and ecosystems.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanic Islands
programme.desc: They've been worshiped and feared over the millennia. But in the wake of drama and destruction, the elements give rise to cultures and nations so beautiful that we've come to know them as the world's greatest volcanic islands.

programme.title: Arthur: Desk Wars/Desperately Seeking Stanley
programme.desc: When Mr. Ratburn moves Brain and Arthur away from their usual desks, it sets off a chain reaction resulting in the most explosive desk war in third grade history! And, Arthur is 8-years old now—does he still need his teddy bear?

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: There is a virus spreading through Lakewood Elementary--it’s new nicknames and it’s changing how everyone treats each other! The playground has been quiet lately--too quiet--and the Tough Customers don't like it one bit.

programme.title: Arthur: Pick a Car, Any Car/Jenna's Bedtime Blues
programme.desc: The family car is broken, and so is Arthur's heart. How can Mom and Dad even think of replacing it? It’s Muffy's annual slumber party, and Jenna is finally invited! But what if the other girls discover that she's an occasional bed-wetter?

programme.title: Arthur: Bud's Knotty Problem/That’s MY Grandma!
programme.desc: When Bud falls in love with a snazzy new pair of boots, he might face his toughest adventure yet - learning to tie his shoes. D.W. gets jealous when Grandma Thora becomes the most popular babysitter in town.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's First Sleepover/Arthur's New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Have you ever been afraid of the dark? Despite D.W.'s threat of aliens, Arthur sets his tent for his first sleepover. Then, what exactly happens at midnight, December 31st? There are plenty of rumors, but no one seems to know for sure.

programme.title: Arthur: Tales of Grotesquely Grim Bunny/Pet Projects
programme.desc: When the comic book store changes owners, the new darker comics are right up Fern's alley, but Arthur can't seem to stomach them. Arthur and Francine enter their pets to compete against each other in the "Perfect Pet" video contest.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Rides The Bandwagon/Dad's Dessert Dilemma
programme.desc: Woogles have their own names and personalities and they're so darned cute! And Arthur's gotta have one, especially now that everyone is collecting them. Arthur wouldn't mind if Dad's infamous dessert "experiments" remained a family secret.

programme.title: Arthur: 1001 Dads/Prunella's Prediction
programme.desc: When Buster insists that he will miss the Father's Day picnic because he has other plans, Arthur is convinced that he's really sad and embarrassed about his parents’ divorce. And Prunella predicts a gift of flashpants, the hot new fashion.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Birthday/Francine Frensky, Superstar
programme.desc: Only four more days until Arthur's birthday party! But to Arthur's horror, it turns out Muffy's having her birthday party on the very same day. And, now that Francine finally has the lead in a school play, she's has become a stage tyrant.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the First World War the RAF had bombers that could fly to Berlin and back. For the first time in a thousand years British civilians found themselves under direct attack - by Zeppelin airships and Gotha bombers.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the war the RAF had aircraft that could escort bombers to targets deep inside Germany and back. With the Gloster Meteor, the RAF had also entered the ‘Jet Age’. Aircraft like the Hawker Hunter and F-86 Sabre took the RAF supersonic.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The 1920s and 30s were uncertain times for the RAF as well as all other armed services. With peace came cuts in spending on new aircraft development.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The series begins before WWI when military commanders struggled to understand what uses aviation might have. The Wright Brothers had been the first to fly a powered aircraft in controlled flight in 1903, but even by 1914 aircraft were still underpowered.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters: Franz Stangl & Gustav Wagner
programme.desc: Nazi Hunters examines how Nazi hunter Simon Wiesenthal tracked down fugitive war criminal Franz Stangl in Brazil. Stangl was responsible for the murder of over 800,000 people.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Keyonnah & Bow Wow
programme.desc: Superfan Keyonnah can hardly believe her luck, she's almost certain that she's been having an online relationship with her childhood crush, the rapper Bow Wow. Is this too good to be true?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Max and co-host iO Tillett Wright help Mecca connect with a boy she's loved for years. But soon it's discovered that Mecca's digital beau may be using her pictures to catfish others! (S6, ep6)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Cassie & Steve
programme.desc: Cassie was on a downward spiral until she got a friend request from a rapper named Steve. Two and a half years later, Cassie and Steve are engaged - but they have yet to meet.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Rod & Ebony
programme.desc: Rod met Ebony on a dating web site four years ago, now it's time for the two to meet in person. Is Ebony who she says she is? What will happen when they meet in real life for the first time?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Divorcee Shawny calls Nev and Max to help uncover the shadowy identity of her attempt at new love. But things get interesting as they discover that Shawny may have secrets of her own. (S6, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Hayley & Alex
programme.desc: Oobah is joined by Catfish US royalty Kamie to help Hayley finally meet Alex. But after five months of avoiding phone calls and cancelling on her, will she get her a fairy tale ending? (S2, ep4)

programme.title: Ex on the Beach
programme.desc: Trouble is brewing on the beach as Geordie Shore's Chloe gets washed up for Marty and reveals her true feelings. Jordan gets aggy, while Nicole and Fatima's feud reaches a dramatic climax. (S7, ep2)

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 110
programme.desc: After going to the last two proms with Taylor as friends, Polly is ready to upgrade her relationship. Stephanie wants to retire her party girl image and ask Josh to be her boyfriend.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 111
programme.desc: Stephanie is tired of only fantasizing about Mike's "sexy face" and she's ready to make him her boyfriend. Sean and Kate were friends at first sight, now Sean wants to up the stakes.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 112
programme.desc: David tells his best friend Maia that he's been in love with her for 9 years. B-Hawk tries to prove to his friend Toni that there's more to him than meets the eye.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 113
programme.desc: Kris tries to woo his best friend Lauren with a special love song. Rachel musters the courage to tell Billy how she really feels.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 114
programme.desc: Bryan and Megan have been best friends for 10 years and he can no longer keep his feeling contained. Kenise thinks that she and James can be more than workout buddies.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 115
programme.desc: Arty Krystal confesses her love to unsuspecting friend Nishell. Mike tells gal pal Rachel that he's in love with her.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 116
programme.desc: Alex tells his best friend's sister that he has strong feelings for her. Asha tells her friend Chris that she wants more than friendship.

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 117
programme.desc: Aja confesses her feelings to best friend Charles. Paulie tries to convince his friend Bethany that there is more between them that just friendship!

programme.title: Friendzone: Friendzone 118

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Strange Life of Dr. Schwartz

programme.title: 48 Hours: Prisoners in Paradise

programme.title: Wardens: Invasive Species

programme.title: Wardens: Axel and Chains

programme.title: Wardens: Night Chase

programme.title: Wardens: Wasted Dummy
programme.desc: This week Warden Lesofski searches out a hunting party that left their elk to rot. While Region 2 Wardens rush into a volatile situation after their decoy is shot from the road.

programme.title: Wardens: Minor Mistakes
programme.desc: A riverside check station catches four minors with no life jackets and a lot of alcohol. Then Warden Golie stops two car full of minors that should not be behind the wheel.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers: Céline Marchand Case

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers: The Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell Case

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Model Marriage / Too Clothes For Comfort / Original Sin / This Year's Model / Vogue Rogue - Part 1
programme.desc: Dazzling high fashion, romance, intrigue, and comedy reign on beautiful seas as the Love Boat sails with a star-studded guest cast on a thrilling cruise to Acapulco.

programme.title: The Love Boat: Lost And Found / Then There Were Two / Maid For Each Other
programme.desc: Gopher's wealthy aunt (Jane Powell) meets a wealthy man (Howard Keel) and is afraid someone may discover her heartbreaking secret.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Pilot
programme.desc: (S01E001 )When Alison's roommate unexpectedly moves out, her "For Rent" ad leads to potential romances, bitter reprisals, and a sexy pool party for the residents of 4616 Melrose Place

programme.title: Melrose Place: Friends And Lovers
programme.desc: (S01E002) Billy and Alison work out the essential boundaries of their new roommate relationship. (TV-PG)

programme.title: Melrose Place: Lost & Found
programme.desc: (S01E003) It's time to read between the lines when Billy entrusts Alison with his particularly bad screenplay, and a daring Jane loses her wedding ring during a wild night at Shooters.

programme.title: Melrose Place: For Love or Money
programme.desc: (S01E004) Alison suspects that Rick, one of the guys from mailroom, is interested in her. Jake takes a job at a coffeehouse, making espresso. (TV-PG)

programme.title: Melrose Place: Leap Of Faith
programme.desc: (S01E005) Jane receives some breathtaking, life-changing information, while Billy attempts a death-defying stunt in order to have an "experience" to write about.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: After The Lovin'
programme.desc: Frustrated by his boss blaming him for burning his mouth on hot soup, Timmy has a special spoon created for Russell. Audrey's plan backfires when she tries to seduce Jeff in the bedroom in order to get him to complete household tasks.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Missed Connections
programme.desc: Timmy wants to reconnect with a woman he met on the subway; Jeff and Audrey turn on each other when former friends snub them.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Five Things
programme.desc: Jeff can't think of five nice things to say about Audrey; Russell encourages Timmy to serenade a woman; Jennifer and Adam mistakenly get Jeff and Audrey's bank statement.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Meat Wars
programme.desc: Audrey drags Jen to a Bon Jovi concert to prove that she's still young and fun, leaving Jeff and Adam at home. Russell finds a phone number in his pocket and asks Timmy to investigate.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Goodbye Dolly
programme.desc: Audrey tries to prepare for motherhood by continuing to repair a doll that she keeps damaging. Meanwhile, Jeff questions whether the very pregnant Brenda should be dating anymore, and Adam tries to convince Jennifer that he is a manly man.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey's Shower
programme.desc: Jen puts the wrong date on the invitations to Audrey's baby shower, Jeff likes Audrey's maternity clothes, and Russell gives up women.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Liz Moves In
programme.desc: Liz temporarily moves in with Jeff and Audrey. Jeff isn't happy with the new guest, but changes his mind when he discovers Liz consistently takes his side against Audrey.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Taking Names
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey realize that the names on their baby list are also the names of women that Russell has slept with. Adam becomes a cycling enthusiast after Jennifer suggests they start riding bikes in the park.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: Feeling lonely after her cat dies, Liz looks for a sperm donor. When Timmy's intellect and innocence don't attract his crush, he tries his hand at playing 'big dog.' Adam rips the vintage wedding dress that Jennifer's family sent her.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cupcake
programme.desc: Russell gets jealous when Timmy manages to outshine him at his own pick-up game. Adam and Jennifer leave pot-laced cupcakes on the kitchen counter, and an unaware Jeff eats one.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competing alongside contestants are Radio 1's Rickie Williams and Melvin Odoom and `Love Island's' Laura Crane, but only those who complete the course and scale the four-metre Warped Wall will progress to the next stage of the competition.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: It's `The Eliminator'. Only the toughest competitors who complete the course against the clock will survive and go through to the Grand Final and get the chance to attempt the 22-metre rope climb to the top of Mount Midoriyama.
